keyword: how many calories in 1 oz of vodka
title: How Many Calories in 1 oz of Vodka?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 oz of vodka, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content, and tips for mixers that affect totals.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 oz of Vodka?
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) distilled vodka, unflavored, no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, and distillation; calories mainly from alcohol. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 1 oz of 80-proof vodka contains about 64 calories, all from alcohol with no carbs, protein, or fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of vodka?
faqs.a: A standard 1 oz shot of 80-proof vodka has about 64 calories.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, plain vodka has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories—e.g., 100-proof adds ~16 kcal per oz over 80-proof.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka?
faqs.a: Vodka provides no protein, fat, fiber, or vitamins; it's essentially empty calories from ethanol.

faqs.q: How many calories in vodka mixed with juice?
faqs.a: The vodka adds 64 kcal per oz, but juice can add 20–50+ kcal depending on type and amount.
